# 總裁報告

2016年的全球政經舞台上「黑天鵝」身影頻仍，英國脫歐公投和美國總統大選結果固然令各種民調淪為笑柄，但更出乎意料的卻是金融市場的反應。以美國大選為例，特朗普當選消息令美股三大指數的期貨在開市前急挫，但開市不久美股指數隨即反彈，此後凱歌高奏，屢創新高。連串事件，凸顯了傳統智慧和思維對預測市場能力的局限性，也標誌着未來環球局勢發展的重大不確定性。

過去一年，多項主要金融數據都反映市場情緒異常敏感：美國十年期國庫債券收益率在7月跌至1.36厘歷史低位後，在美國總統大選後的12月中旬飆升至2.6厘。反映美元兌一籃子貨幣走勢的美匯指數在年底升至14年高位；紐約原油期貨價格由年初每桶26美元低位反彈至年底的54美元。本港股市方面，恒生指數全年微升86點，但期內峰谷差逾6,000點。外圍形勢驚濤駭浪，更形金融體系尤其是貨幣和銀行體系穩定的重要和可貴。

2016年1月，國際對沖基金部署狙擊人民幣和港元的傳言甚囂塵上，人心虛怯。金管局迅即向市場發放明確、堅定的訊息，我們絕對有信心、有能力捍衛聯匯制度和香港的金融體系穩定，適時穩住了市場信心。綜觀2016年全年，港元長時間貼近強方兌換保證。由於銀行體系資金非常充裕，即使去年12月和今年3月美國聯儲局加息，對港元利率和匯率並未有明顯的即時影響。

香港銀行體系繼續穩步發展，去年整體貸款錄得6.5%溫和增長，資產質素保持良好，不良貸款比率維持在0.85%的健康水平，遠低於2000年以來約2%的長期平均水平。銀行體系的資本充足率和流動性比率均保持在高於法定要求的高水平。在樓宇按揭業務方面，經過七輪逆周期措施，新造住宅物業按揭平均成數從2009年9月的64%下降至2016年底的51%，平均供款與入息比率也從2010年8月的41%下降至2016年底的34%，為樓市周期一旦逆轉而令銀行體系受到衝擊時，提供了所需的緩衝。金管局會繼續密切留意樓市的發展，因應周期變化而採取合適措施，以保持銀行體系穩定。

進一步強化銀行體系穩定的立法工作去年取得令人鼓舞的進展。優化存款保障制度和針對金融機構「大得不能倒」風險的兩條法例，及時在上屆立法會任期屆滿前順利通過。前者加快存款保障金的發放速度，簡化發放程序，有助加強存戶對銀行體系的信心；後者則為包括銀行在內的金融機構建立處置機制，防範這些機構一旦倒閉而引發的系統性金融風險，並盡量避免動用公帑為它們「包底埋單」。金管局已在今年4月1日設立處置機制辦公室，落實執行法例的要求和跟進工作。

銀行業素有「百業之母」之稱，是實體經濟和普羅市民日常生活倚重的儲蓄、支付渠道和信貸來源。年內，部分中小企業界代表反映融資有困難。金管局即時與銀行界溝通，希望銀行在維持審慎風險管理的情況下，盡可能為中小企的營運和發展繼續提供資金支援。我們又透過轄下香港按揭證券公司，加強向工商界推廣政府的「中小企融資擔保計劃」，並與銀行業界緊密溝通，以釋除疑慮、釐清誤解及理順處理壞帳的索償程序，從而提高銀行參與該計劃的意願。多管齊下，收到了一定成效，根據金管局對銀行進行的調查，中小企整體信貸額度在去年保持平穩，超過九成企業的信貸額度得以維持甚至增加。同時，「中小企融資擔保計劃」的申請數字亦明顯上升。

近年來金管局大力推動普及金融，就是考慮到基本銀行服務已是營商和日常生活不可或缺的環節。去年當我們得知有些海外公司和初創企業在香港開戶遇到困難後，旋即展開跟進工作，與多個國際商會和企業協會聯繫，並跟銀行業界深入溝通，對症下藥。去年9月我向香港所有銀行簽發通告，闡釋應如何理解金管局針對反洗錢和恐怖分子資金籌集活動的「風險為本」監管原則，如何將這項原則應用在開戶申請和對現有客戶的盡職審查措施上，強調銀行不應對所有客戶採用「一刀切」的要求和程序。經我們與銀行和商界協商後，企業開戶情況有所改善，但仍有進步空間，這也是我們今年工作重點之一。

普及金融還涉及銀行分行服務的覆蓋面。金管局一直鼓勵銀行在營商圖利之餘，也要顧及市民的基本銀行服務需要。金融科技一日千里，銀行提供服務的渠道也更趨多元化。除了日益普及的網上銀行服務外，去年多家銀行紛紛推出流動銀行車或視像櫃員機服務，提供較傳統櫃員機更貼身、更全面的銀行服務。在我們的推動下，多家銀行也計劃在偏遠地區設立實體分行，加強對當區居民的服務。

金融中心的發展就如逆水行舟，因此，金管局多年來不斷為香港金融業發展尋求新的契機，開拓新的領域。2016年可說是成果豐碩的一年，當中又以金融科技(Fintech)和基建融資為亮點。

在金融科技方面，香港的零售支付服務在2016年進入新時代。金管局去年發出13個儲值支付工具牌照，通過發牌和恒常監管制度為零售支付服務創造有利的營商環境，配以一系列公眾教育宣傳，讓消費者在享受新科技帶來的便捷之餘，權益也得到合理保障。

此外，去年3月金管局成立了金融科技促進辦公室，以此平台推動與銀行業相關的金融科技發展。幾個月間，我們推出多項新猷，包括「網絡防衛計劃」(Cybersecurity Fortification Initiative)，為強化銀行體系網絡安全建立風險評估、資訊共享和人才培訓三足鼎立的新平台。我們並與香港應用科技研究院（應科院）合作，開展分布式分類帳技術(distributed ledger technology)專項研究，探討該技術在香港銀行業應用的可行性，並在應科院設立金融科技創新中心(Fintech Innovation Hub)，為銀行業界和金融科技界提供技術支援。金管局的銀行監管部門還設立「金融科技監管沙盒」(Fintech Supervisory Sandbox)，讓銀行在較小和可控範圍內測試新技術的應用，為新產品、新服務的開發提速。自去年9月至今年3月，已有6家銀行共14項新技術項目使用沙盒進行測試，部分項目亦已相繼推出市場，為市民帶來更多金融科技的新產品。

世界各地對基建融資的需求巨大，特別是「一帶一路」倡議提出以來，基建融資更成中外矚目的議題。香港是亞洲的國際金融中心，在基建融資領域極具優勢。去年7月金管局成立了基建融資促進辦公室(Infrastructure Financing Facilitation Office，簡稱IFFO)，搭建一個嶄新和獨特的平台，匯聚60多家世界級的多邊機構、機構投資者、銀行、保險公司和其他金融機構、基建項目的建設和營運方、各類專業機構等，就基建投融資課題互通訊息、交流經驗、尋求合作機會。IFFO成立至今已舉辦十多場大型會議、研討會和工作坊，金管局並分別與國際金融公司(International Finance Corporation)、全球基礎設施中心(Global Infrastructure Hub)、國家開發銀行(China Development Bank)和中國進出口銀行(The Export-Import Bank of China)簽署了共同促進基建投融資活動的《諒解備忘錄》。起步時間雖然不長，但為香港未來作為基建投融資中心奠下堅實的基礎。

拆牆鬆綁是提升競爭力的不二法門。年內，金管局積極參與和支援特區政府修訂稅務條例，向在港經營集團內部財資業務的企業提供有利的稅務環境。我們並積極接觸跨國企業，吸引它們來港發展或擴充企業財資活動，藉此進一步強化香港金融市場的功能。

去年的離岸人民幣市場處於調整期。受市場波動和對人民幣匯率預期等因素影響，全球離岸人民幣資金池規模普遍收縮。儘管如此，香港仍穩執離岸人民幣業務的牛耳，保持全球最大的人民幣資金池，經香港結算的人民幣維持在日均約8,600億元人民幣高位。為進一步優化香港離岸人民幣市場的流動性安排，去年10月我們將一級流動性提供行由7家增至9家，支援雙邊流動資金的總額度由原來的140億元人民幣增至180億元，確保在離岸人民幣市場資金出現緊絀的情況下，仍可保持市場有序運作。去年12月股票市場「深港通」開通，令香港的人民幣業務再添動力。金管局亦正與內地有關當局研究「債券通」方案，進一步便利兩地投資者參與債券市場，並優化債券市場基礎設施的聯繫。

儘管去年全球投資環境充斥着各種不穩因素，但有賴於過去一段時間所採取的多項防禦性部署，外匯基金去年錄得681億港元投資收入。自1994年以來外匯基金的複合年度投資回報率達4.8%，高於同期2.1%的本地通脹率。

外匯基金將繼續推動多元化投資，包括進一步擴展資產類別，加大對於信貸資產、抵禦通脹類投資產品和新興市場的投資。而作為多元化投資旗艦的「長期增長組合」，透過私募股權和房地產項目等投資於另類資產。該組合自2009年啟動以來一直保持不俗的成績，成立至今的平均內部回報率年率約12%，而隨着政府「未來基金」部分投放於該組合，我們加快了投資步伐，去年底「長期增長組合」的資產規模約1,818億港元，已批出但未提取作投資的總額約1,338億港元。外匯基金將繼續恪守「保本先行、長期增值」的投資策略，在保持充裕的流動性和備用資金的前提下，尋求長遠穩定的回報。

# CEO Report

In 2016, the global political and economic landscape was marked by frequent "black swan" events. While the Brexit referendum and the U.S. presidential election results defied most predictions, the financial markets’ reaction was even more surprising. For example, news of Donald Trump’s victory initially sent futures on the three major U.S. stock indices plummeting before the market opened, but they quickly rebounded, subsequently reaching new highs. These events underscored the limitations of conventional wisdom in predicting market behavior and signaled a significant degree of uncertainty in the future trajectory of global affairs.

Over the past year, several key financial indicators have reflected heightened market volatility. The yield on the U.S. 10-year Treasury note fell to a historical low of 1.36% in July, then surged to 2.6% in mid-December following the U.S. presidential election. The U.S. Dollar Index, which tracks the dollar's performance against a basket of currencies, reached a 14-year high by year-end. Meanwhile, New York crude oil futures prices rebounded from a low of $26 per barrel at the beginning of the year to $54 per barrel by year-end. In Hong Kong's stock market, the Hang Seng Index rose slightly by 86 points for the year, though the peak-to-trough difference during the period exceeded 6,000 points. Amidst this volatile external environment, the stability of the financial system—particularly the banking and monetary sectors—has become even more crucial.

In January 2016, rumors of international hedge funds targeting the Renminbi and Hong Kong dollar gained traction, causing market anxiety. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority swiftly issued clear and resolute messages, affirming its full confidence and capability in defending the linked exchange rate system and maintaining the stability of Hong Kong’s financial system, thereby stabilizing market sentiment. Throughout 2016, the Hong Kong dollar remained consistently close to the strong-side convertibility undertaking. Due to ample liquidity within the banking system, the Federal Reserve’s interest rate hikes in December 2015 and March 2016 had no significant immediate impact on Hong Kong dollar interest rates or exchange rates.

Hong Kong’s banking system continues to develop steadily. Last year, overall loans grew by a moderate 6.5%, and asset quality remained strong. The ratio of non-performing loans was maintained at a healthy 0.85%, well below the long-term average of approximately 2% since 2000. Both the banking system’s capital adequacy ratio and liquidity ratio remained at high levels exceeding regulatory requirements.
In the mortgage sector, following seven rounds of countercyclical measures, the average loan-to-value ratio for new residential mortgages decreased from 64% in September 2009 to 51% by the end of 2016. The average debt-to-income ratio also fell from 41% in August 2010 to 34% by the end of 2016, providing a necessary buffer should the property market cycle reverse and impact the banking system. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) will continue to closely monitor developments in the property market and take appropriate measures in response to cyclical changes to maintain the stability of the banking system.

Legislative efforts to strengthen the stability of the banking system made significant progress last year. Two key pieces of legislation—designed to improve the deposit insurance system and address risks associated with institutions that are "too big to fail"—were successfully passed before the end of the previous Legislative Council term. The first measure accelerates the disbursement of deposit insurance funds and simplifies the process, bolstering depositor confidence in the banking system. The second establishes a resolution mechanism for financial institutions, including banks, to prevent systemic financial risks that could arise from their failure and to minimize the need for public funds to provide financial assistance. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority established a Resolution Mechanism Office on April 1st of this year to implement the legislation and oversee related follow-up work.

The banking sector is vital to Hong Kong's economy, serving as a key channel for savings, payments, and credit for businesses and individuals. This year, some small and medium-sized enterprise (SME) representatives reported facing difficulties in securing financing. In response, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) immediately engaged with the banking sector, encouraging banks to continue supporting SME operations and development while maintaining prudent risk management. We also strengthened the promotion of the government’s SME Financing Guarantee Scheme through the Hong Kong Mortgage Corporation, and worked closely with banks to address concerns, clarify misunderstandings, and streamline the claims process for bad debts, thereby encouraging their participation in the scheme. These efforts have yielded positive results. According to an HKMA survey of banks, overall SME credit limits remained stable last year, with over 90% of businesses maintaining or even increasing their limits. Simultaneously, applications for the SME Financing Guarantee Scheme have also risen significantly.

In recent years, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority has been actively promoting financial inclusion, recognizing that basic banking services are essential for both business operations and daily life. Last year, upon learning that some overseas companies and start-ups were encountering difficulties opening accounts in Hong Kong, we promptly initiated follow-up efforts, engaging with multiple international chambers of commerce and business associations and conducting in-depth discussions with the banking sector to implement targeted solutions. In September of last year, I issued a circular to all Hong Kong banks, clarifying how to interpret the HKMA’s risk-based regulatory principles concerning anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing, and how to apply these principles to account opening applications and know your customer procedures for existing clients. I emphasized that banks should not adopt a uniform approach to customer requirements and procedures. Following consultations with banks and the business community, the situation regarding corporate account openings has improved, but further progress remains a key priority this year.

Financial inclusion also depends on the reach of bank branch services. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has consistently encouraged banks to consider the basic banking needs of the public while also seeking profit. With the rapid development of financial technology, the ways banks provide services are becoming increasingly diverse. In addition to the growing popularity of online banking, several banks launched mobile banking vans and video teller machines last year, offering more personalized and comprehensive services than traditional ATMs. As a result of our efforts, several banks are also planning to establish physical branches in remote areas to serve local residents.

The development of a financial center is a constant effort to stay afloat, and over the years, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority has continuously sought strategic initiatives and explored new areas to foster the growth of Hong Kong’s financial industry. 2016 was a year of considerable success, with financial technology (Fintech) and infrastructure financing as leading developments.

In the field of financial technology, Hong Kong’s retail payment services entered a new era in 2016. Last year, the HKMA issued 13 licenses for digital payment solutions, creating a favorable business environment for retail payment services through licensing and ongoing regulatory oversight. Alongside a series of public education campaigns, this ensures consumers can enjoy the convenience of new technologies while their rights are reasonably protected.

In addition, in March last year, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority established the Fintech Facilitation Office as a platform to promote fintech development within the banking sector. Over several months, we launched several initiatives, including the “Cybersecurity Fortification Initiative,” which established a new framework for strengthening bank cybersecurity through risk assessment, information sharing, and talent training. We also partnered with the Hong Kong Applied Science and Technology Research Institute (ASTRI) to conduct dedicated research on distributed ledger technology, exploring its feasibility for application in Hong Kong’s banking sector. This collaboration included establishing a Fintech Innovation Hub at ASTRI to provide technical support to both the banking and fintech industries. The HKMA’s banking supervision department also introduced the “Fintech Supervisory Sandbox,” allowing banks to test new technologies within a smaller, controlled environment, accelerating the development of new products and services. From September last year to March this year, six banks tested 14 new technology projects using the Sandbox, and some of these projects have already been launched in the market, bringing more fintech products to the public.

World demand for infrastructure financing is substantial, particularly since the launch of the Belt and Road Initiative, which has made it a key focus for both domestic and international attention. Hong Kong, as Asia’s leading international financial center, possesses a distinct advantage in this field. Last July, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority established the Infrastructure Financing Facilitation Office (IFFO) to create a new and unique platform. This platform brings together over 60 world-class multilateral organizations, institutional investors, banks, insurance companies, and other financial institutions, alongside infrastructure project developers, operators, and various professional organizations, to facilitate information exchange, share experiences, and explore collaboration opportunities. Since its establishment, IFFO has hosted more than a dozen large-scale conferences, seminars, and workshops. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has also signed Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs) with the International Finance Corporation, the Global Infrastructure Hub, the China Development Bank, and the Export-Import Bank of China to jointly promote infrastructure financing. Although operational for a relatively short time, IFFO has laid a solid foundation for Hong Kong’s future as a leading infrastructure financing hub.

To enhance competitiveness, it’s essential to remove obstacles. This year, the HKMA actively participated in and supported the HKSAR Government’s revision of tax regulations, creating a favorable tax environment for companies conducting corporate treasury activities in Hong Kong. We are also proactively engaging with multinational corporations to attract them to develop or expand their treasury operations here, thereby further strengthening the functions of Hong Kong’s financial market.

The offshore RMB market underwent an adjustment period last year. Affected by market volatility and expectations regarding the RMB exchange rate, the global pool of offshore RMB liquidity contracted. Despite this, Hong Kong maintained its dominant position in offshore RMB business, retaining the world’s largest RMB liquidity pool, with RMB transactions settled through Hong Kong averaging approximately 860 billion yuan daily. To further optimize liquidity arrangements in Hong Kong’s offshore RMB market, we increased the number of primary liquidity providers from seven to nine last October and raised the total bilateral liquidity support quota from 14 billion yuan to 18 billion yuan, ensuring the market’s orderly operation even during periods of liquidity strain. The launch of the Shenzhen-Hong Kong Stock Connect in December further propelled Hong Kong’s RMB business. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority is also working with mainland authorities to study the Bond Connect scheme, aiming to facilitate greater participation by investors from both regions in the bond market and enhance bond market infrastructure connectivity.

Despite a global investment environment fraught with uncertainty last year, the Exchange Fund recorded investment income of HK$68.1 billion, thanks to a series of defensive measures implemented over the past period. Since 1994, the Exchange Fund’s annualized compounded investment return has reached 4.8%, exceeding the local inflation rate of 2.1% for the same period.

The Exchange Fund will continue to promote diversified investments, including expanding asset classes and increasing investments in credit assets, inflation-protected products, and emerging markets. The "Long-Term Growth Portfolio," a key component of this diversification strategy, invests in alternative assets such as private equity and real estate. Since its launch in 2009, the portfolio has consistently delivered strong performance, with an average annual internal rate of return of approximately 12%. With the allocation of a portion of the government’s “Future Fund,” we have accelerated our investment pace. As of the end of last year, the portfolio’s assets under management were approximately HKD 181.8 billion, with a total of approximately HKD 133.8 billion committed but undrawn for investment. The Exchange Fund will continue to adhere to its investment strategy of prioritizing capital preservation and long-term growth, seeking stable returns in the long term while maintaining ample liquidity and contingency reserves.

# 2016年摘要

# 經濟及金融環境

隨着環球經濟及貿易活動疲弱，香港經濟增長回軟。年內本港股市及住宅物業市場波動，置業負擔能力依然偏緊。

儘管環球市場風險及衝擊增加，香港銀行體系仍維持穩健。銀行資本及流動性狀況維持良好；資產質素輕微轉差，但仍處於健康水平。

# 貨幣穩定

儘管面對波動的外圍環境，港元匯率仍然保持穩定，反映聯繫匯率制度承受外來衝擊的能力。

貨幣市場繼續運作暢順，銀行同業流動資金充裕。於12月，繼美國聯邦儲備局決定上調聯邦基金利率目標範圍，香港基本利率上調25基點至1.00厘。

# 銀行體系穩定

金管局加強監管銀行的風險管治架構，以及信用、流動性與科技風險管理。金管局亦採取具體行動，促進普及金融和應對企業在香港開立及維持銀行帳戶遇到的困難。

監管政策方面，就本港實施國際監管及會計標準的準備工作取得重大進展，當中包括《金融機構（處置機制）條例》下的處置框架。

# 香港的國際金融中心地位

香港維持其作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐和資產管理中心的地位。稅制獲進一步完善，營造更有利環境，吸引跨國公司在香港設立企業財資中心。

為發展香港成為基建融資中心與金融科技樞紐，金管局成立基建融資促進辦公室及金融科技促進辦公室。金管局順利開始實施儲值支付工具及零售支付系統的監管制度，並批出13個儲值支付工具牌照。

# 儲備管理

儘管投資環境困難，充斥黑天鵝事件，但有賴過去幾年所採取的一連串防禦措施，增強外匯基金的抗震能力，外匯基金錄得2%的整體投資回報。

金管局加快多元化投資的步伐，特別是長期增長組合的投資。

# 機構職能

金管局透過傳媒、公眾教育活動及其他各種渠道與社會和市場保持有效溝通，增進公眾對金管局政策及運作的了解。

金管局繼續加強機構管治，包括推動員工提升專業能力、嚴格控制財政及加強資訊科技保安，以應付推行新措施及日益繁重的工作所帶來的挑戰。

# 2016 Overview

# Economic and Financial Setting

Hong Kong’s economic growth has softened alongside a weakening global economy and trade. The local stock market and residential property market experienced fluctuations throughout the year, and housing affordability remains challenging.

Despite increasing global market volatility, the Hong Kong banking sector remains resilient. Banks maintain robust capital and liquidity levels; asset quality has seen a slight decline but remains at a healthy level.

# Monetary Stability

Despite the volatile external environment, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate has remained stable, reflecting the linked exchange rate system’s ability to withstand external shocks.

The money market continued to operate smoothly, with ample liquidity in the interbank sector. In December, following the Federal Reserve's decision to raise the target range for the federal funds rate, Hong Kong's benchmark interest rate was increased by 25 basis points to 1.00 percent.

# Banking System Soundness

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) has strengthened its supervision of banks' risk management frameworks, including credit, liquidity, and technology risks. The HKMA has also taken specific measures to promote financial inclusion and address the difficulties businesses face in opening and maintaining bank accounts in Hong Kong.

In regulatory policy, significant progress has been made in preparations for the implementation of international regulatory and accounting standards in Hong Kong, including the resolution framework under the Financial Institutions (Resolution Mechanism) Ordinance.

# Hong Kong: An International Financial Center

Hong Kong continues to serve as a leading global hub for offshore RMB businesses and asset management, bolstered by a refined tax system that attracts multinational companies to establish corporate treasury centers there.

To develop Hong Kong into a hub for infrastructure financing and fintech, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) has established the Infrastructure Financing Facilitation Office and the Fintech Facilitation Office. The HKMA has successfully commenced implementing the regulatory regime for stored value payment instruments and retail payment systems, and has issued 13 licenses for stored value payment instruments.

# Reserve Management

Despite a challenging investment environment marked by unforeseen events, the Exchange Fund achieved an overall investment return of 2%, thanks to a series of defensive measures implemented in recent years.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority is accelerating its diversified investments, particularly in long-term growth portfolios.

# Organizational Role

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority maintains effective communication with the public and the market through media, public education initiatives, and other channels to enhance understanding of its policies and operations.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority continues to strengthen institutional governance, including promoting employee professional development, strictly controlling finances, and enhancing information technology security, to address the challenges posed by implementing new measures and the growing workload.

# 經濟及金融環境

隨着環球經濟及貿易活動疲弱，香港經濟增長在2016年回軟。面對外圍環境不明朗因素加劇，預期2017年經濟增長仍然溫和。

# 經濟回顧

# 概覽

香港經濟增長在2016年放緩，實質本地生產總值增長由2015年的2.4%降至1.9%（表1）。淨出口是主要拖累，當中訪港旅遊業疲弱令服務輸出受壓（圖1）。本地需求動力亦放緩，但繼續為整體經濟增長提供主要支持。勞工市場大致保持穩定，失業率維持於3.3至3.4%的低位。由於本地成本及外部價格壓力減退，消費物價通脹進一步放緩。面對波動的外圍環境及多變的市場氣氛，資產市場增添起伏。鑑於住宅物業市場再度暢旺，政府於11月實施新印花稅措施。

儘管外圍環境波動及美元利率上升，本港外匯及貨幣市場繼續運作暢順。港元現貨匯率於1月份略為轉弱後一直在7.75附近水平徘徊。年內兌換保證並無被觸發，總結餘與未償還外匯基金票據及債券合計幾乎維持不變，約為1.2萬億港元。繼美國於12月中加息後，金管局基本利率由0.75厘上調至1厘。香港銀行同業拆息及較長期債券收益率維持在相對較低水平，但在接近年底時稍升，部分反映美元相應拆息及收益率的走勢。整體銀行貸款增長在2016年加快至6.5%。雖然整體貸款質素略為轉差，但特定分類貸款比率仍然維持在極低水平。

圖 1 組成部分對實質本地生產總值增長的貢獻
資料來源：政府統計處。

表 1 按開支項目計的實質本地生產總值增長（比對上期）

註：本地固定資本形成總額經季節因素調整的按季增減幅度不詳。
資料來源：政府統計處。

# 本地需求

本地需求的增長力度在2016年略為減弱。儘管穩定的就業及收入狀況繼續為私人消費帶來支持，但其增速仍降至1.6%，部分反映經濟不明朗因素加劇。政府消費增長亦略為減慢至3.3%。本地固定資本形成總額繼續按季大幅上落（圖2），累計全年收縮0.5%。私營部門機器及設備購置成為主要拖累，在營商前景欠佳下連續第3年收縮，而樓宇及建造活動則因住屋動工項目增加而轉殷。

圖 2 本地需求
資料來源：政府統計處。

# 外部需求

香港出口在接近2016年底時有回穩跡象，但綜合全年表現仍然乏力（圖3）。貨品出口較2015年的低基數上升1.7%。香港對先進經濟體的出口仍然呆滯；但在區內貿易流動轉趨穩定下，香港對中國內地、印度、韓國、新加坡及台灣的出口則較2015年好轉。

部分反映零售銷售在近年急速增長後轉趨正常化，香港服務輸出在2016年顯著收縮3.1%。貨品進口在2015年收縮後於2016年收復部分失地，服務輸入則部分受惠於本地居民外遊意欲而持續增長。2016年整體貿易順差收窄，拖累本地經濟增長。

圖 3 貨品出口及服務輸出
資料來源：政府統計處。

# 通脹

通脹壓力在2016年仍然受控。剔除政府一次性紓緩措施的影響後，基本通脹率由2015年的2.5%下降至2016年的2.3%（圖4）。在早前新訂私人住宅租金下調所帶來的傳遞效應下，綜合消費物價指數中的租金組成項目通脹回落。受惠於全球商品價格偏軟及港元強勢，進口價格通脹受到遏抑。另一方面，在勞工成本穩定增長及租金成本壓力（尤其零售範疇）有所紓緩下，本地成本壓力保持溫和。

圖 4 基本消費物價通脹
資料來源：政府統計處。

# 勞工市場

勞工市場在2016年大致保持穩定，勞工供求升幅相若。按行業分析，旅遊相關行業的勞工市場狀況轉差，其他行業則大致平穩。整體而言，經季節因素調整失業率由2015年的3.3%稍升至3.4%（圖5）。在勞工市場穩定下，名義工資在首3季上升3.8%，而2015年的升幅為4.6%。首3季實質工資亦上升0.9%，而2015年的升幅為1.5%。

圖 5 勞工市場狀況
資料來源：政府統計處。

# 股市

香港股市在2016年大幅上落。受到人民幣貶值壓力及內地股市波動所影響，恒生指數於2月份跌至3年來的低位（圖6）。本港股市在3月份跟隨美國及其他主要股市顯著造好而回升。儘管英國脫歐公投觸發市場波動，但在外界預期美國聯邦儲備局會放緩加息步伐及其他主要央行推行貨幣寬鬆政策下，市場氣氛迅速改善。恒生指數於9月份升至24,100點的一年高位。然而，受到美國總統選舉結果及預計美國會加快加息步伐所影響，本港股市在第4季再度受壓。整體而言，恒生指數於2016年微升0.4%，在2015年則下跌7.2%。平均每日成交額由上年的1,056億港元降至669億港元，而本港股市集資總額亦由上年的11,156億港元減少至4,901億港元。

圖 6 資產價格
資料來源：差餉物業估價署及香港交易及結算所有限公司。

# 物業市場

住宅物業市場在2016年略為波動。物業成交量於第1季錄得歷史新低後，在其後數月有所回升，但在11月推出新印花稅措施後再度下挫。整體而言，成交量在2016年稍跌至54,701宗。另一方面，樓價自第2季起上升並超越2015年9月的高位，2016年的累計升幅為7.8%（圖6）。置業負擔能力依然偏緊，樓價與收入比率為15.9，超越1997年的歷史高位；而收入槓桿比率為72.0%，遠高於長期平均水平。2 由於銀行推出具競爭力的按揭計劃，按揭利率稍為回落，於接近年底時則跟隨香港銀行同業拆息上升而略為回升。工商物業市場方面，全年交投大致保持穩定。由於非住宅物業價格較2015年高位回落，相應租金收益率較上年微升，但仍處於低位。

# 經濟前景

# 經濟環境

預期2017年實質本地生產總值增長將保持溫和。政府預測經濟增長幅度介乎2至3%之間，私營機構分析員預測增幅平均為2.0%。外圍方面，隨着環球宏觀經濟及金融環境變得不明朗，全球經濟及貿易增長或會保持溫和；再加上港元實質有效匯率因美元強勢而上升，將會抑制香港的出口表現。本地方面，雖然穩定的就業及收入狀況會支持消費，但受利率上升所拖累，預期私人消費會溫和增長。受惠於住屋供應增加及多個基建項目展開，樓宇及建造活動應會穩步增長，但營商氣氛疲弱及利率趨升將影響商界資本投資。

# 通脹及勞工市場

預計2017年通脹壓力仍然溫和。一方面環球商品價格上漲及中國內地通脹趨升或會令進口價格上升，另一方面港元轉強卻可能會令上述壓力受到遏抑。在溫和的經濟動力下，本地成本壓力仍可受控，但由於新訂住宅租金於2017年初上升，綜合消費物價指數中的租金組成項目通脹可能會稍升。市場共識預測2017年整體通脹率為1.9%，政府預期基本通脹率為2.0%。雖然不明朗因素加劇或會影響招聘意欲，私營機構分析員預計2017年失業率會維持於3.4%。

# 不明朗因素及風險

2017年經濟前景會受制於眾多不明朗因素，當中來自外圍環境的影響尤甚。美國新一屆政府政策的不確定性，將令環球經濟前景變得不明朗，當中可能出現的保護主義政策亦會對全球貿易帶來阻力。英國脫歐進程及歐洲幾個主要國家舉行大選，亦可能導致資產市場波動，並影響港元資金流向。此外，美國利率正常化將會令本地貨幣狀況收緊，並對實質經濟及資產價格構成下調壓力；當中樓市繼續偏緊，市場前景仍然很不明朗。短期而言，按揭息率仍然偏低、就業及收入狀況穩定，以及地產發展商加推優惠（例如折扣及現金回贈）令累積的購買力獲得釋放，均可為住宅需求帶來支持。另一方面，新印花稅措施、美國可能加快加息步伐及房屋供應穩步增長，則可能繼續為樓市帶來阻力。

# 銀行體系表現

儘管本港經濟面對阻力，加上國際政治事件出乎意料的結果令市場波動加劇，香港銀行體系在2016年仍然穩健。認可機構的資本及流動性狀況維持良好，資產質素輕微轉差，但仍處於健康水平。

# 利率走勢

隨着美國利率上升，香港銀行同業拆息在11月及12月顯著上升。反映零售銀行港元資金成本的綜合利率則輕微上升（圖7）。

# 盈利走勢

零售銀行在2016年的盈利略為改善，其香港業務的整體除稅前經營溢利增長8.7%。增長主要是由外匯及衍生工具業務收入（+39.7%）、附屬公司派發的股息收入（+123.5%）及淨利息收入（+2.8%）所帶動，不過部份增長被費用及佣金收入減少(-11.3%)所抵銷。零售銀行除稅後溢利錄得44.4%的升幅，增長主要來自非經常項目。零售銀行除稅後平均資產回報率亦相應由2015 年的 1.04% 上升至 1.44%（圖 8）。

圖8 零售銀行的表現

2016年零售銀行淨息差為1.32%，與2015年的水平相同（圖9）。雖然零售銀行繼續將剩餘資金配置於息率較低而流動性較高的金融投資，但利息收益的減少被利息成本下降所抵銷。

# Economic and Financial Landscape

As global economic and trade activity weakens, Hong Kong’s economic growth slowed in 2016. With increasing uncertainty in the external environment, economic growth is expected to remain moderate in 2017.

# Review of the Economy

# Overview

Hong Kong's economic growth slowed in 2016, with real GDP growth declining from 2.4% in 2015 to 1.9% (Table 1). Net exports were a significant restraint, as weak inbound tourism dampened service exports (Figure 1). Domestic demand also eased, but continued to provide the primary support for overall economic growth. The labor market remained largely stable, with the unemployment rate holding steady at a low of 3.3% to 3.4%. Consumer price inflation further eased as local cost pressures and external price pressures diminished. Facing a volatile external environment and shifting market sentiment, asset markets experienced increased volatility. In response to the resurgence of the residential property market, the government implemented new stamp duty measures in November.

Despite external volatility and rising U.S. interest rates, Hong Kong's foreign exchange and money markets continued to operate smoothly. The Hong Kong dollar spot rate weakened slightly in January and has since hovered around the 7.75 level. The Convertibility Undertaking was not triggered during the year, and the aggregate balance of the Exchange Fund, together with outstanding Exchange Fund bills and bonds, remained almost unchanged at approximately HKD 1.2 trillion. Following the U.S. Federal Reserve’s interest rate hike in mid-December, the HKMA’s base rate was raised from 0.75% to 1%. Hong Kong interbank offered rates (HIBOR) and yields on longer-term bonds remained at relatively low levels, but edged up towards the end of the year, partly reflecting the movements in U.S. equivalent rates. Overall bank lending growth accelerated to 6.5% in 2016. While overall loan quality deteriorated slightly, specific classified loan ratios remained at very low levels.

Figure 1: Contribution to Real GDP Growth by Components.
Source: Census and Statistics Department.

Note: Seasonally adjusted quarterly changes in total fixed capital formation are not available.
Source: Census and Statistics Department.

# Local Needs

Local demand growth eased slightly in 2016. While stable employment and income continued to support private consumption, its growth rate slowed to 1.6%, partly reflecting increased economic uncertainty. Government consumption growth also eased to 3.3%. Local fixed capital formation continued to fluctuate significantly on a quarterly basis (Figure 2), resulting in a 0.5% annual contraction. Private sector purchases of machinery and equipment were the primary factor in this decline, contracting for the third consecutive year amid a weak business outlook, while building and construction activity improved due to increased housing starts.

Figure 2: Local Demand. Source: Government Statistics Department.

# External Needs

Hong Kong's exports showed signs of stabilization towards the end of 2016, but the overall annual performance remained weak (Figure 3). Goods exports increased by 1.7% compared to the low base of 2015. Exports to advanced economies remained sluggish; however, exports to mainland China, India, South Korea, Singapore, and Taiwan improved compared to 2015, as regional trade flows became more stable.

Retail sales growth moderated after a period of rapid expansion, and Hong Kong's service exports declined significantly by 3.1% in 2016. Merchandise imports partially recovered in 2016 following a contraction in 2015, while service imports continued to grow, partly benefiting from increased outbound travel by local residents. The narrowing of the overall trade surplus weighed on local economic growth in 2016.

Figure 3: Merchandise Exports and Service Exports. Source: Census and Statistics Department.

# Inflation (Trending)

Inflationary pressures remained well contained in 2016. After excluding the impact of temporary government relief measures, the underlying inflation rate fell from 2.5% in 2015 to 2.3% in 2016 (Figure 4). The decline in private residential rents led to lower rent inflation within the composite consumer price index. Import price inflation was contained thanks to weaker global commodity prices and a strong Hong Kong dollar. Meanwhile, local cost pressures remained moderate, supported by stable labor costs and a gradual easing of rental costs, particularly in the retail sector.

Figure 4: Core Consumer Price Inflation
Source: Census and Statistics Department.

# Job Market

The labor market remained stable in 2016, with balanced supply and demand. Tourism-related sectors experienced a softening of labor market conditions, while other industries remained stable. Overall, the seasonally adjusted unemployment rate rose slightly from 3.3% in 2015 to 3.4% (Figure 5). With this stability, nominal wages increased by 3.8% in the first three quarters of the year, compared to a 4.6% increase in 2015. Real wages also rose by 0.9% during that period, compared to a 1.5% increase in 2015.

Figure 5: Labor Market Conditions. Source: Government Statistics Department.

# Stock Market

Hong Kong's stock market experienced significant volatility in 2016. Affected by depreciation pressure on the Renminbi and fluctuations in the mainland Chinese stock market, the Hang Seng Index fell to a three-year low in February (Figure 6). In March, the market rebounded, following strong performance in US and other major markets. Despite market volatility triggered by the Brexit referendum, sentiment quickly improved as investors anticipated a slowdown in interest rate hikes by the US Federal Reserve and monetary easing policies by other major central banks. The Hang Seng Index reached a one-year high of 24,100 points in September. However, influenced by the results of the US presidential election and expectations of accelerated interest rate hikes by the US, the market came under pressure again in the fourth quarter. Overall, the Hang Seng Index rose slightly by 0.4% in 2016, compared to a 7.2% decline in 2015. Average daily turnover decreased from HKD 105.6 billion the previous year to HKD 66.9 billion, and total capital raised by the Hong Kong stock market also fell from HKD 1,115.6 billion to HKD 490.1 billion.

Figure 6: Asset Prices
Data Source: Rating and Valuation Department and Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited.

# Real Estate Market

The residential property market experienced slight fluctuations in 2016. Following a historic low in transaction volume during the first quarter, activity rebounded in the subsequent months before declining again with the introduction of new stamp duty measures in November. Overall, transaction volume decreased marginally to 54,701 units for the year. On the other hand, property prices rose from the second quarter, surpassing the peak reached in September 2015, with a cumulative increase of 7.8% (Figure 6). Home affordability remained constrained, with a price-to-income ratio of 15.9, exceeding the historical high of 1997. The income leverage ratio stood at 72.0%, significantly above the long-term average. Mortgage rates initially eased due to competitive mortgage plans offered by banks, but subsequently rose towards the end of the year, tracking increases in the Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate. In the commercial property market, transaction activity remained broadly stable throughout the year. As prices of non-residential properties retreated from their 2015 highs, corresponding rental yields increased slightly compared to the previous year, although they remained low.

# Economic Prospects

# Economic Climate

Real GDP growth in 2017 is expected to remain moderate. The government forecasts economic growth between 2% and 3%, while private sector analysts predict an average increase of 2.0%. Globally, increasing uncertainty in the macroeconomic and financial environment may lead to moderate global economic and trade growth. Furthermore, the Hong Kong dollar’s real effective exchange rate has risen due to the strength of the US dollar, which will weaken Hong Kong's export performance. Domestically, stable employment and income conditions will support consumption, but rising interest rates are likely to moderate private consumption growth. Construction and property activities should grow steadily, benefiting from increased housing supply and the commencement of several infrastructure projects; however, weak business sentiment and rising interest rates will affect business capital investment.

# The Inflation and the Labor Markets

Inflationary pressures are expected to remain moderate in 2017. Rising global commodity prices and inflation in the Mainland could push up import costs, but a stronger Hong Kong dollar is likely to offset this effect. With moderate economic growth, local cost pressures should remain under control. However, a rise in new residential rents at the beginning of the year may cause a slight increase in the rental component of the consumer price index. Market consensus forecasts an overall inflation rate of 1.9% for 2017, while the government anticipates an underlying inflation rate of 2.0%. Despite potential uncertainties impacting job creation, private sector analysts predict the unemployment rate will remain at 3.4% in 2017.

# Significant Uncertainties and Risks

The economic outlook for 2017 will be shaped by numerous uncertainties, particularly those arising from the external environment. Policy shifts from the new U.S. administration could cloud the global economic outlook, and potential protectionist measures may hinder global trade. The Brexit process and elections in several major European countries could also trigger volatility in asset markets and affect Hong Kong dollar flows. Furthermore, the normalization of U.S. interest rates will tighten local monetary conditions and put downward pressure on the real economy and asset prices; the property market remains tight, and its prospects are highly uncertain. In the short term, however, low mortgage rates, stable employment and income conditions, and incentives offered by property developers—such as discounts and cash rebates—releasing pent-up purchasing power will support housing demand. Conversely, new stamp duty measures, the possibility of accelerated U.S. interest rate hikes, and a steady increase in housing supply may continue to present challenges to the property market.

# Banking Sector Performance

Despite economic headwinds and increased market volatility stemming from unexpected international political developments, Hong Kong's banking system remained resilient in 2016. Authorized institutions maintained healthy capital and liquidity positions, and asset quality experienced a minor decline but remained at a sound level.

# Interest Rate Movements

As U.S. interest rates rose, the Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate (HIBOR) significantly increased in November and December. The composite rate, reflecting the HKD funding costs of retail banks, rose only slightly (Figure 7).

# Profit Trends

Retail banking profitability improved slightly in 2016. Its Hong Kong operations saw an 8.7% increase in pre-tax operating profit, primarily driven by income from foreign exchange and derivatives, dividend income from subsidiaries, and net interest income, which rose by 39.7%, 123.5%, and 2.8% respectively. This growth was partially offset by a decrease in fee and commission income of 11.3%. After-tax profit increased by 44.4%, largely due to non-recurring items. The average return on assets also rose from 1.04% in 2015 to 1.44% (Figure 8).

Figure 8: Retail Banking Performance

The net interest margin for retail banking in 2016 was 1.32%, the same as in 2015 (Figure 9). Although retail banks continued to allocate surplus funds to lower-yielding, more liquid financial investments, the decrease in interest income was offset by a decrease in interest costs.

Figure 9: Net Interest Margin for Retail Banking

Non-interest income accounted for 44.3% of total operating income, remaining largely stable. Fee income and commission income decreased by 11.3%, while dividend income and income from foreign exchange and derivatives increased by 123.5% and 39.7%, respectively.

# 貨幣穩定

儘管外圍環境波動及美元息率上升，港元匯率在2016年仍然保持穩定。香港貨幣市場亦繼續運作暢順，銀行同業流動資金充裕。聯繫匯率制度繼續展現高度承受衝擊的能力，是香港貨幣及金融穩定的基石。

# 目標

香港貨幣政策的主要目標是維持貨幣穩定，即確保港元匯價穩定，使港元在外匯市場兌美元的匯率保持在7.75至7.85港元兌1美元的區間內。該貨幣體制主要採用貨幣發行局制度，規定由外匯基金所持的美元儲備向貨幣基礎提供最少百分之百的支持；貨幣基礎若有變動，美元儲備亦必須作出相應增減，與貨幣基礎的變動百分之百配合。

貨幣基礎（表1）包括：
- 負債證明書（為3間發鈔銀行發行的銀行紙幣提供十足支持）
- 政府發行的流通紙幣及硬幣
- 銀行在金管局所持結算戶口的結餘總額（即總結餘）
- 金管局代表政府發行的外匯基金票據及債券。

表1 貨幣基礎

金管局透過自動利率調節機制及履行兌換保證的堅決承諾來維持港元匯率的穩定。若市場對港元的需求大過供應，令市場匯率轉強至7.75港元兌1美元的強方兌換保證匯率，金管局會向銀行沽出港元、買入美元，使總結餘增加及港元利率下跌，從而令港元匯率從強方兌換保證匯率水平回復至7.75到7.85的兌換範圍內。相反，若港元供過於求，令市場匯率轉弱至7.85港元兌1美元的弱方兌換保證匯率，金管局會向銀行買入港元，使總結餘減少及推高港元利率，港元匯率隨之由弱方兌換保證匯率水平回復至兌換範圍內。

# 2016年回顧

# 匯率穩定

港元匯率在2016年首兩個月略有波動後，於年內餘下時間一直窄幅徘徊。港元在2016年初兌美元顯著轉弱，由1月4日的7.7510降至1月20日的7.8196（圖1）。港元匯率轉弱符合聯繫匯率制度的正常運作，反映美國在2015年12月加息後港元與美元的負息差擴濶。此外，其他市場相關因素，包括香港股市出現拋售、內地及香港經濟前景不及以前樂觀、人民幣匯率波動增加，以及亞洲貨幣普遍疲弱，均導致港元需求減弱。受到市場氣氛改善支持，港元匯率在2月略為轉強，並自3月起一直在7.753至7.776之間窄幅徘徊，即使英國脫歐公投及美國總統選舉引發市場波動亦未受影響。由於市場預期美國會在夏季加息，港元匯率於5月出現短暫的轉弱壓力。整體而言，港元外匯市場在2016年一直正常運作。

圖 1 2016年市場匯率

由於兌換保證沒有被觸發，因此總結餘及未償還外匯基金票據及債券總額在2016年沒有明顯變動，大致維持在12,222億港元左右（圖2）。年內金管局增發總值1,320億港元的外匯基金票據，以滿足銀行在流動性管理方面的龐大需求，令總結餘相應減少至2016年底的2,596億港元。增發外匯基金票據符合貨幣發行局制度的原則，這是由於增發外匯基金票據只屬貨幣基礎組成部分之間的轉移，即由總結餘移至未償還外匯基金票據及債券，貨幣基礎仍然由外匯儲備提供十足支持。

圖 2 2016年總結餘及未償還外匯基金票據及債券

# 貨幣市場

香港銀行同業拆息在2016年大部分時間維持在較低水平（圖3）。香港銀行同業拆息在1、2月期間因金融市場波動加劇而面對一些上升壓力，但在3月隨着金融環境回復平靜而轉趨穩定。於第2及第3季，儘管市場關注英國脫歐公投結果以及美國貨幣市場基金改革，香港銀行同業拆息仍大致保持穩定。部分受到年底資金需求影響，以及港元拆息追回美元拆息的升幅，香港銀行同業拆息在第4季錄得較大升幅。儘管如此，短期銀行同業拆息在2016年大致維持在低於基本利率的水平。

因應美國聯邦基金利率目標範圍於12月14日（美國時間）由0.25至0.50厘上調至0.50至0.75厘，基本利率於12月15日由0.75厘上調至1.00厘。基本利率的調整是按照於2009年3月26日宣布的經修訂計算公式作出。按照該公式，基本利率定於美國聯邦基金利率目標範圍下限加50基點的水平，或隔夜與1個月香港銀行同業拆息的5天移動平均數的平均值水平，兩者以較高者為準。

圖 3 2016年香港銀行同業拆息

港元遠期匯率點子在1月出現大幅溢價，大致跟隨港元與美元息差的走勢，以及部分反映投資者為其港股組合作出外匯對沖的需求（圖4）。遠期匯率溢價在2月開始收窄。隨着市況轉趨穩定，港元遠期匯率點子在3至11月期間大致保持穩定，其後在12月因港元與美元息差收窄而再度上升。整體而言，香港貨幣市場運作暢順，銀行同業流動資金充裕。貼現窗借貸在2016年並不活躍，僅涉及53億港元。

# 聯繫匯率制度

儘管經歷多次區內以至全球金融危機，聯繫匯率制度（聯匯制度）過去數十年來一直是香港貨幣及金融穩定的基石。2016年初市場波動加劇，再度引起有關港元轉弱及情況有如亞洲金融危機時期的評論。為增進各界對聯匯制度的認識，金管局向公眾闡釋聯匯制度的技術細節，並指出香港金融體系有能力抵禦衝擊。政府亦重申堅決維持聯匯制度。外匯及貨幣市場穩定，進一步鞏固公眾對政府維持聯匯制度的決心以及港元作為支付及保值貨幣的信心。國際貨幣基金組織在與香港進行年度第四條磋商時，明確表示聯匯制度是最適合香港的貨幣制度，指出香港靈活的經濟結構、充裕的財政及儲備緩衝、以及穩健有效的金融監管是聯匯制度的後盾。

# Financial Stability

Despite fluctuations in the external environment and rising U.S. interest rates, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate remained stable in 2016. The Hong Kong money market also continued to operate smoothly, with ample liquidity in the interbank sector. The linked exchange rate system continued to demonstrate a high capacity to withstand shocks, serving as the cornerstone of Hong Kong’s monetary and financial stability.

# Aim

Hong Kong’s monetary policy primarily aims to maintain a stable currency by ensuring the stability of the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate. This means keeping the exchange rate within a range of HK$7.75 to HK$7.85 per US dollar in the foreign exchange market. This system operates under a currency board framework, requiring the Exchange Fund to hold US dollar reserves equal to at least 100% of the monetary base. These US dollar reserves are adjusted in direct proportion to any changes in the monetary base.

The monetary base (Table 1) includes:
- Banknote Certificates (providing full backing for banknotes issued by the three note-issuing banks)
- Government-issued circulating banknotes and coins
- The total balances of banks’ clearing accounts held with the HKMA (i.e., total balances)
- Exchange Fund bills and bonds issued by the HKMA on behalf of the Government.

Table 1: Monetary Base

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority maintains the stability of the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate through its automatic interest rate adjustment mechanism and its commitment to the linked exchange rate system. If market demand for the Hong Kong dollar exceeds supply, causing the market exchange rate to strengthen towards the conversion rate of 7.75 Hong Kong dollars per US dollar, the HKMA will sell Hong Kong dollars and buy US dollars from banks, increasing its foreign reserves and lowering Hong Kong dollar interest rates. This action brings the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate back within the exchange rate band of 7.75 to 7.85. Conversely, if there is an excess supply of Hong Kong dollars, causing the market exchange rate to weaken towards the conversion rate of 7.85 Hong Kong dollars per US dollar, the HKMA will buy Hong Kong dollars from banks, decreasing its foreign reserves and raising Hong Kong dollar interest rates. This restores the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate to within the exchange rate band.

# 2016 Retrospective

# Stable Rates

The Hong Kong dollar exchange rate experienced slight volatility in the first two months of 2016 before stabilizing within a narrow range for the remainder of the year.  Early in 2016, the Hong Kong dollar weakened noticeably against the US dollar, declining from 7.7510 on January 4 to 7.8196 on January 20 (Figure 1). This depreciation aligned with the normal operation of the linked exchange rate system, reflecting a widening negative interest rate differential between the Hong Kong dollar and the US dollar following the US Federal Reserve’s December 2015 interest rate increase.  Contributing factors included selling in the Hong Kong stock market, a less optimistic economic outlook for both mainland China and Hong Kong, increased volatility in the Renminbi exchange rate, and broader weakness among Asian currencies, all of which dampened demand for the Hong Kong dollar.  Supported by improving market sentiment, the Hong Kong dollar briefly strengthened in February and subsequently fluctuated within a narrow band between 7.753 and 7.776 from March onwards, proving resilient even to market disruptions caused by the UK’s Brexit referendum and the US presidential election.  Market expectations of a further US interest rate increase in the summer led to a short period of downward pressure on the Hong Kong dollar in May. Overall, the Hong Kong dollar foreign exchange market functioned smoothly throughout 2016.

Figure 1: 2016 Market Exchange Rates

The total surplus and the outstanding amount of foreign exchange fund notes and bonds remained largely unchanged at approximately HKD 12,222 billion in 2016 (Figure 2). During the year, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority issued HKD 132 billion in foreign exchange fund notes to meet the substantial liquidity management needs of banks, resulting in the total surplus decreasing to HKD 2,596 billion by the end of 2016. This issuance of foreign exchange fund notes is consistent with the principles of the Currency Board System, as it represents a transfer within the monetary base—from the total surplus to outstanding foreign exchange fund notes and bonds—while the monetary base remains fully supported by foreign exchange reserves.

Figure 2: Year-End Balance and Outstanding Foreign Exchange Fund Notes and Bonds (2016)

# Money Market

Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate (HIBOR) remained at relatively low levels for most of 2016 (Figure 3). It experienced some upward pressure in January and February due to increased financial market volatility, but stabilized in March as conditions eased. Despite market concerns surrounding the Brexit referendum and reforms in U.S. money market funds, HIBOR remained broadly stable during the second and third quarters. A significant increase was recorded in the fourth quarter, partly influenced by year-end funding demand and the Hong Kong dollar rate tracking the rise in U.S. dollar rates. Nevertheless, short-term HIBOR rates were generally below the benchmark rate throughout 2016.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority increased its base rate from 0.75% to 1.00% on December 15, following a U.S. Federal Funds Rate target range increase from 0.25% to 0.50% to 0.50% to 0.75% on December 14 (U.S. time). This adjustment was made in accordance with a revised calculation formula announced on March 26, 2009, which sets the base rate at the higher of either the lower bound of the U.S. Federal Funds Rate target range plus 50 basis points or the 5-day moving average of the one-month Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate (HIBOR).

Figure 3: Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate in 2016

The Hong Kong dollar forward exchange rates showed a significant premium in January, largely tracking the spread between Hong Kong dollar and US dollar rates and reflecting investor demand for foreign exchange hedging of their Hong Kong equity portfolios (Figure 4). The premium began to narrow in February. As market conditions stabilized, the rates remained largely stable from March to November, before rising again in December as the HKD-USD rate differential narrowed. Overall, the Hong Kong money market operated smoothly, with ample liquidity in the banking system. Discount window lending was minimal in 2016, involving only HKD 5.3 billion.

# Linked Exchange Rate Regime

Despite experiencing multiple regional and global financial crises, the Linked Exchange Rate System (LETS) has remained a cornerstone of Hong Kong’s monetary and financial stability for decades. In early 2016, increased market volatility prompted concerns about a potential weakening of the Hong Kong dollar, reminiscent of the Asian financial crisis. To enhance public understanding of the LETS, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) explained the system’s technical details and emphasized the resilience of Hong Kong’s financial system. The government reaffirmed its commitment to maintaining the LETS. Stability in foreign exchange and currency markets further solidified public confidence in the government’s resolve to uphold the LETS and the Hong Kong dollar as a currency for payments and a store of value. During its annual Article IV consultation with Hong Kong, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) explicitly stated that the LETS remains the most suitable monetary regime for Hong Kong, noting that the city’s flexible economic structure, ample fiscal and reserve buffers, and sound and effective financial regulation underpin the system.

Figure 4: 2016 USD/HKD Forward Rates

Given that a sound banking system plays a crucial role in the smooth operation of the linked exchange rate system, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) continues to closely monitor banks' credit, liquidity, and interest rate risk management, as well as the results of stress tests. It has strengthened supervision of banks’ lending to individuals, corporations, and Mainland China to ensure the banking system can absorb potential shocks. In light of the normalization of U.S. monetary policy, Hong Kong interbank offered rates (HIBOR) have begun to rise. The HKMA reminds the public to remain vigilant and prepare for potential market volatility and risks.

To enhance the transparency of the Exchange Fund’s accounts, a portion of its assets has been designated to support the monetary base since October 1998. The support ratio (i.e., the ratio of supporting assets to the monetary base) fluctuated narrowly between 106.3% and 107.5% in 2016, without reaching either the upper or lower limits. The ratio was 106.7% as of December 31, 2016 (Figure 5). Under the Linked Exchange Rate System, while certain Exchange Fund assets have been designated as part of the support portfolio, the entire asset base of the Exchange Fund is available to support the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate. The Exchange Fund’s substantial financial resources provide a strong buffer for monetary and financial stability in Hong Kong when faced with sudden shocks.

# Research

The Monetary Policy Committee, under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee, is responsible for monitoring and discussing issues related to the monetary and financial stability of Hong Kong. In 2016, the committee discussed topics including the alignment of economic growth between Hong Kong, mainland China, and the United States, external demand for the Hong Kong dollar, and Hong Kong’s financial conditions index. Meeting records of the Monetary Policy Committee and reports on the operation of the Monetary Policy Committee, submitted by the HKMA, are available on the HKMA website.

The Hong Kong Institute for Monetary and Financial Research continues to support research in monetary policy, banking, and finance. In 2016, the Institute hosted 18 scholars and published 20 working papers.

The research center hosted six international conferences and seminars during the year, including:
- In January, the 7th Annual International Conference on the Chinese Economy, themed “China’s Growing Impact on the Global Economy.” The conference featured eight research papers covering topics such as China’s economic rebalancing and growth potential, the impact of Chinese economic activity on other nations, the influence of the RMB on global and regional economies, and trends in interest rate arbitrage and information flow within RMB markets.
- A joint seminar on exchange rates and macroeconomics with the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology and Keio University was held in March, addressing issues such as global economic imbalances, exchange rate dynamics, capital controls, and monetary policy.
- In August, the Real Estate and Financial Stability Seminar, co-organized with City University of Hong Kong, presented research on topics including the relationship between age, demographics, and housing demand; the impact of large investors on asset quality; fluctuations in Hong Kong housing prices; housing affordability; the influence of mortgage regulations on homeownership decisions; and the residential property market in mainland China.
- In October, a seminar on the Asia-Pacific economic system, co-organized with the Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the Bank for International Settlements, explored “Resilience of Regional Economic Systems in a Volatile Global Environment.” The seminar brought together senior officials from central banks, leading scholars, and experts from international organizations and private institutions for interactive roundtable discussions on key challenges facing the Asia-Pacific region. Discussions included financial imbalances in Asia, capital flows, the spillover effects of mainland China’s economic slowdown on neighboring economies, and the outlook for potential growth in the region.

The Research Center also hosted the 14th Annual Summer Conference in August and the 14th China Mainland Economic Conference in September, addressing asset quality and financial stability concerns at mainland banks. These events attracted participants from academia, the financial services sector, and central banks worldwide. Throughout the year, the Center further organized 21 public seminars covering a broad range of economic, monetary, and financial matters.

As of the end of 2016, circulating banknotes issued by commercial banks totaled HK$407.8 billion, a 13.2% increase from the previous year (Figures 6, 7, and 8). Government-issued banknotes and coins reached HK$11.8 billion, a 5.3% increase year-on-year (Figures 9 and 10). Among these government-issued banknotes and coins, HK$10 banknotes accounted for HK$4.4 billion, with polymer banknotes representing 86% of the total.

年內有更多地產發展商向物業買家直接提供按揭貸款，其按揭成數往往高於金管局對認可機構實施審慎要求下許可的水平。金管局密切留意有關發展，並定期與認可機構溝通，以評估銀行有否繼續有效管理對地產發展商的風險承擔。此外，土地註冊處應金管局要求，同意向認可機構提供電子提示服務。使用這項服務的認可機構，當有其他按揭文書就其承按的物業交付土地註冊處辦理註冊時，會收到該處發出的電子提示訊息。這項服務將有助應對按揭借款人未有事先獲得承按認可機構同意下，擅自以同一物業借取額外按揭貸款的情況。土地註冊處已於2017年第1季推出電子提示服務。

# 業務操作及科技風險的監管

與其他國際金融中心一樣，香港面對的網絡威脅與日俱增。金管局於2016年接到認可機構通報發現未經授權股票交易及試圖入侵其支付系統的個案，並隨即採取行動應對這些攻擊造成的風險。金管局發出電子銀行服務提示，提醒公眾慎防網上股票交易騙案，並建議公眾採取預防措施。金管局又向認可機構發出通告，就進一步加強網上銀行服務監控可採取的保安措施提供指引。有關試圖入侵銀行支付系統的個案，金管局在香港首次發現相關個案時已提醒認可機構留意這類騙案，並在警方協助下說明這類騙案的犯案手法，以及要求認可機構在加強支付操作的監控措施時須顧及有關手法。

為進一步提升銀行體系應對網絡風險的能力，金管局於2016年5月推出網絡防衛計劃。此計劃由三項支柱組成，即網絡防衛評估框架、專業培訓計劃及網絡風險資訊共享平台（詳見「香港的國際金融中心地位」一章「金融科技促進辦公室」部分）。金管局在12月向認可機構發出通告，列載網絡防衛評估框架的實施時間表。

金融科技在銀行業的應用於2016年長足發展，多間認可機構推出新的金融科技產品，其中個人小額支付服務、非接觸式流動支付及生物認證這幾個範疇的發展尤為顯著。金管局在9月推出「金融科技監管沙盒」，讓認可機構能在受控環境中就其金融科技項目先作試行，而無需完全符合金管局的監管規定。有關安排讓認可機構在正式推出金融科技服務前，可及早收集真實數據及用戶意見，以便作出適當修改。截至2016年底，共有6項使用金融科技監管沙盒的申請獲批，有關的新金融科技產品涉及生物認證、證券交易及用於按揭估值的區塊鏈。金管局又在11月上調無需雙重認證的網上銀行個人小額支付服務的交易上限至每個帳戶每日5,000港元，以應付日益增加的簡便個人支付服務需求。

2016年發生多宗與物業相關的騙案，當中涉及騙徒假扮業主，試圖藉申請按揭貸款或出售有關物業謀取利益。雖然這些騙案並不涉及認可機構，但金管局仍與警方及香港銀行公會（銀行公會）緊密合作，就偵測及防止這些騙案在銀行業內發生向認可機構提供指引。年內金管局出版兩期《操作事故通訊》，與業界分享從認可機構發生過的操作事故中汲取的教訓。金管局亦對認可機構的業務操作風險管理制度、詐騙管理方法、信託╱託管業務操作及防範違規或未經授權交易活動的風險管理及監控措施進行現場審查及專題評估。

# 財資業務及流動性風險的監管

2016年發生數宗重大政治事件，引致金融市場在年內多次大幅波動。與此同時，美國利率繼續緩慢地正常化，聯邦公開市場委員會於12月決定調高聯邦基金利率，是全球金融危機以來的第二次。為應對這些政治事件作好準備，金管局與境外監管機構繼續保持緊密聯繫，並評估事件對香港銀行體系的影響，以及要求銀行保持警覺並加強其風險管理以應對不利的市場發展。

在流動性風險管理方面，金管局進行額外的流動性壓力測試，以評估銀行體系應對可能發生的嚴峻壓力情境的能力，並對認可機構作出跟進，以加強其應對能力。金管局在2015年針對利率風險管理進行一輪現場審查後，再進行額外的現場審查，以評估認可機構的市場風險管理，並要求在監控方面存有不足的認可機構作出糾正。

# 打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集活動

金管局的風險為本打擊洗錢監管包括現場審查及非現場審查（包括就特定事件與認可機構進行的監管聯繫），主要針對洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險較高的範疇。審查內容涵蓋認可機構對洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險的評估、風險為本方法的落實情況，以及交易監察與制裁合規的制度和程序。金管局的專項監管人員在2016年共進行17次現場審查及30次非現場審查。

在政策發展方面，金管局優先處理某些行業及人士在開立銀行帳戶方面遇到困難的情況，並發出指引與「常見問題」，以釐清若干客戶盡職審查的規定，以及金管局就風險為本方法的監管期望。與此同時，金管局繼續與業內公會緊密合作，發出指引以協助認可機構處理某些範疇的風險，例如貿易相關的洗錢活動。

# Banking System Stability

Despite increased global market risks and volatility, the Hong Kong banking system remained stable in 2016. During the year, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) strengthened the risk governance frameworks and the effectiveness of credit and liquidity risk management systems within these institutions. Recognizing the growing threat of cyberattacks, the HKMA also enhanced its supervision of technology risk management. To uphold its commitment to combating financial crime, the HKMA continued to prioritize the effectiveness of anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing controls. Furthermore, the HKMA took concrete steps to foster a customer-centric culture, promote financial inclusion, and address the challenges faced by overseas small and medium-sized enterprises and start-ups in establishing and maintaining bank accounts in Hong Kong. The HKMA also reinforced its oversight of how these institutions sell investment and insurance products, aiming to further protect customers.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has made significant progress in preparing Hong Kong for the implementation of international regulatory and accounting standards, including the net stable funding ratio, large exposure limits, IFRS 9, and the resolution framework under the Financial Institutions (Resolution Mechanism) Ordinance.

# 2016 Year in Review

# Regulatory Landscape

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority conducted 188 off-site reviews in 2016, covering a wide range of areas including the CAMEL ratings of authorized institutions, corporate governance, business operations, and risk management. The HKMA strengthened its communication with the boards of directors of authorized institutions to enhance risk governance and corporate culture within the banking sector. In addition to holding meetings with boards or board committees, the HKMA also met separately with independent non-executive directors (INEDs) to exchange views on corporate culture and risk governance. The HKMA also held tripartite meetings with authorized institutions and their external auditors. Furthermore, the HKMA assessed whether the compensation systems of authorized institutions contributed to effective risk management.

In terms of capital adequacy, the HKMA reviews the capital plans of authorized institutions, including their future capital targets, to prepare for the full implementation of Basel III buffer capital in 2019. Solvency stress tests for authorized institutions have also been improved to reflect the current macroeconomic environment. The HKMA also carefully assesses the recovery plans of major retail banks and provides recommendations for areas where improvements are needed.

The HKMA continues to conduct thematic assessments alongside regular on-site inspections, focusing these assessments on areas identified as higher risk. This approach allows the HKMA to allocate regulatory resources more effectively to address significant risks faced by authorized institutions. In 2016, the HKMA conducted a total of 377 on-site inspections and thematic assessments. These inspections and assessments primarily focused on credit risk management and monitoring, particularly risks associated with mainland operations. Another key area of focus was combating money laundering and terrorist financing. The HKMA also increased the number of on-site inspections and thematic assessments related to liquidity, operational, and technology risk management. During the year, inspection teams also conducted on-site reviews of authorized institutions’ securities, investment products, insurance, and Mandatory Provident Fund (MPF)-related businesses.

Table 1 summarizes the Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s regulatory work in 2016.

# Regulation of Credit Risk

# Credit Growth and Asset Quality

Bank loans grew moderately in 2016. The total outstanding loans increased by 6.5% for the year, compared to an increase of 3.5% in 2015 (Table 2). Customer deposits outpaced bank loan growth, causing the overall loan-to-deposit ratio to decline from 70.1% at the end of 2015 to 68.4% at the end of 2016.

Table 2: Growth in Loans and Advances

The total amount of related loans on the mainland increased by 7% to HKD 35,640 billion (CNY 35,640 billion) at the end of 2016 (Table 3), including HKD 5,450 billion in loans provided by subsidiaries of banks registered in Hong Kong.

The asset quality of the banking sector remained stable in 2016. Although the non-performing loan ratio for retail banking rose slightly from 0.69% at the end of 2015 to 0.72% at the end of 2016, it remained significantly below the long-term average of 2.4% since 2000. During the same period, the non-performing loan ratio for the banking sector as a whole increased from 0.73% to 0.85%. The asset quality of domestic-related loans within the sector mirrored this trend; retail banking’s non-performing loan ratio for these loans also rose slightly, from 0.78% to 0.82%, while the sector’s corresponding ratio increased from 0.77% a year earlier to 0.80%.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has allocated significant regulatory resources to ensure that authorized institutions maintain prudent credit approval standards and effective loan classification and provisioning systems. The HKMA closely monitors the growing exposure of these institutions to risk associated with mainland China’s private enterprises, as well as credit risks arising from investments in debt securities to enhance returns. Furthermore, the HKMA has conducted a targeted assessment of authorized institutions’ credit risk management practices concerning the distribution of high-risk investment products.

# Mortgage Loan

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority continues to closely monitor the mortgage lending activities of licensed banks. Residential property prices began to fluctuate in September 2015, but rose again in March 2016, increasing by 8% for the year. The average loan-to-value ratio for new residential mortgages declined from 64% in September 2009, before the HKMA introduced its first round of countercyclical measures, to 51% in December 2016. The average debt-to-income ratio for new residential mortgages also declined from 41% in August 2010, when the HKMA first introduced a cap on debt-to-income ratios, to 34% in December 2016 (Figure 1).

Figure 1: Average Loan-to-Value Ratio and Repayment-to-Income Ratio for New Residential Property Mortgages.
The Hong Kong Monetary Authority introduced repayment-to-income ratio limits before implementing the first round of countercyclical property loan measures.

Under the seventh round of countercyclical measures introduced by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) in February 2015, authorized institutions using the internal ratings-based approach to calculate credit risk capital requirements were required to apply a 15% minimum capital requirement based on credit risk to their entire residential mortgage loan portfolio, previously limited to new mortgage loans. This regulation took effect in June 2016.

More property developers are offering mortgages directly to property buyers this year, often with loan-to-value ratios exceeding those permitted under the Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s (HKMA) prudential requirements for authorized institutions. The HKMA is closely monitoring this development and regularly communicates with authorized institutions to assess whether banks continue to effectively manage risks associated with property developers. At the HKMA’s request, the Land Registry has agreed to provide an electronic alert service to authorized institutions. When another mortgage document relating to a property they have mortgaged is submitted for registration, the institution will receive an electronic alert from the Land Registry. This service helps prevent borrowers from taking out additional mortgages on the same property without the mortgagee’s prior approval. The Land Registry launched the electronic alert service in the first quarter of 2017.

# Risk Management and Oversight

Hong Kong, like other international financial centers, faces a growing threat of cyberattacks. In 2016, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) responded swiftly after receiving reports from licensed institutions of unauthorized stock trading and attempts to breach their payment systems. The HKMA issued a public advisory urging caution against online stock trading scams and recommending preventative measures. It also provided guidance to licensed institutions on strengthening the security of their online banking services. Regarding attempts to compromise bank payment systems, the HKMA had previously alerted institutions to be vigilant against such fraud, explaining the methods used by criminals with police assistance. The HKMA also emphasized the need for institutions to incorporate these methods into their enhanced payment monitoring procedures.

To further enhance the banking system’s ability to respond to cyber risks, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority launched the Cyber Defence Programme in May 2016. This programme comprises three key components: a Cyber Defence Assessment Framework, a Professional Training Programme, and a Cyber Risk Information Sharing Platform. Further details can be found in the “Financial Technology Promotion Office” section of the chapter “Hong Kong’s Status as an International Financial Centre.” In December, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority issued a notice to authorized institutions outlining the implementation timeline for the Cyber Defence Assessment Framework.

Financial technology saw significant advancements in the banking sector in 2016, with multiple authorized institutions launching new fintech products. Key developments included personal small-value payment services, contactless mobile payments, and biometric authentication. In September, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) introduced a regulatory testing environment, known as the "Fintech Regulatory Sandbox," allowing authorized institutions to test their fintech initiatives in a controlled setting without fully complying with HKMA regulations. This arrangement enables institutions to gather real-world data and user feedback before officially launching new services, allowing for necessary adjustments. By the end of 2016, six applications to participate in the Fintech Regulatory Sandbox had been approved, covering biometric authentication, securities trading, and blockchain technology for mortgage valuations. In November, the HKMA also raised the transaction limit for online banking personal small-value payment services that do not require dual authentication to HKD 5,000 per account per day, to meet the growing demand for convenient personal payment options.

In 2016, several property-related fraud cases occurred, involving fraudsters impersonating property owners to obtain benefits through mortgage loan applications or property sales. Although these cases did not involve authorized institutions, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) closely collaborated with the police and the Hong Kong Banking Association to provide guidance to authorized institutions on detecting and preventing such fraud within the banking sector. Throughout the year, the HKMA published two issues of the Incident Report, sharing lessons learned from operational incidents experienced by authorized institutions. The HKMA also conducted on-site reviews and thematic assessments of authorized institutions’ business operational risk management systems, fraud management practices, trust and custodial services, and risk management and monitoring measures to prevent unauthorized transactions.

# Regulation of Financial Assets and Operations and Liquidity Risk

In 2016, several major political events triggered significant fluctuations in financial markets throughout the year. Simultaneously, U.S. interest rates continued their gradual normalization, and in December, the Federal Open Market Committee raised the federal funds rate for the second time since the global financial crisis. To prepare for these events, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority maintained close contact with overseas regulators, assessing the impact on the Hong Kong banking system and urging banks to remain vigilant and bolster their risk management practices.

In managing liquidity risk, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) conducts additional liquidity stress tests to assess the banking system’s ability to withstand severe stress scenarios and follows up with authorized institutions to enhance their capacity. Following a round of on-site reviews on interest rate risk management in 2015, the HKMA has also conducted further reviews to evaluate the market risk management of authorized institutions, requiring those with inadequate monitoring to implement corrective actions.

# Combating Money Laundering and the Financing of Terrorism

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s risk-based supervision for anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing includes both on-site and off-site assessments, including regulatory contact with licensed firms regarding specific matters. These assessments primarily target areas with heightened risks of money laundering and terrorist financing. They evaluate licensed firms’ risk assessments, the implementation of risk-based practices, and the systems and procedures for transaction monitoring and sanctions compliance. In 2016, the Authority’s specialized supervisory staff conducted 17 on-site assessments and 30 off-site assessments.

The HKMA prioritizes addressing challenges faced by certain industries and individuals when opening bank accounts. It has also issued guidance and FAQs to clarify customer due diligence requirements and its supervisory expectations regarding risk management. Simultaneously, the HKMA continues to collaborate closely with industry associations to provide guidance for authorized institutions in managing risks, such as those related to trade-based money laundering.

# 香港的國際金融中心地位

香港維持其作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位。去年的稅務修訂有助營造有利環境，吸引跨國公司在港設立企業財資中心。為發展香港成為基建融資中心與金融科技樞紐，金管局在年內成立基建融資促進辦公室及金融科技促進辦公室。年內金管局向儲值支付工具發行人批出13個牌照。香港穩健的財政表現及龐大的對外資產淨值，繼續獲得信貸評級機構確認，其中標準普爾維持對香港AAA的評級。

# 概覽

受到環球金融市場波動及人民幣匯率前景不確定性影響，2016年全球離岸人民幣業務有所放緩。儘管如此，香港維持其作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位，處理全球約七成人民幣支付交易。深港股票市場交易互聯互通機制「深港通」於12月推出，標誌着內地資本帳開放的另一里程碑，並且是提升香港的國際金融中心地位的重要一步。金管局亦透過擴大對市場的人民幣流動性支援及推出措施增加人民幣市場流動性的透明度，強化金融基建。

金管局於7月成立基建融資促進辦公室(IFFO)，透過匯聚主要持份者促進基建發展，並發展香港成為基建融資中心。截至2017年1月底，已有超過60間機構加入IFFO成為合作夥伴。年內金管局亦成功推動法例修訂的通過，以消除稅務不對稱及提供稅務優惠，鼓勵跨國及內地公司在香港設立企業財資中心，為金融及專業服務行業帶來更多商機。在香港駐設業務的機構投資者數目亦逐漸增加，其中作為全球第三大主權基金的阿布扎比投資局於10月宣布在香港成立海外辦事處，是該機構唯一設於阿布扎比以外的辦事處。

國際貨幣基金組織（基金組織）在去年的第四條磋商討論中對我們致力鞏固香港作為國際金融中心的地位給予正面評價。年內金管局積極參與國際討論，致力推進全球與區內金融穩定。金管局亦與國際信貸評級機構保持緊密溝通，有關工作有助香港的信貸評級在2016年獲得主要信貸評級機構確認。

香港金融基建的安全有效運作與持續發展，對鞏固香港作為國際金融中心及全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的競爭力發揮重要作用。處理銀行同業交易的4個即時支付結算(RTGS)系統及債務工具中央結算系統（CMU系統）在2016年達到100%的系統可供使用率，高於99.95%的目標水平。

金管局在2016年進一步加強香港的零售支付金融基建。年內根據2016年11月全面生效的《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》（《支付條例》）批出總共13個儲值支付工具牌照。電子支票服務涵蓋範圍亦已擴展至香港和廣東省（包括深圳）之間的跨境支付。

為促進香港金融科技的發展，金管局於3月成立金融科技促進辦公室。年內實施的多項重要措施均取得理想進展。

金管局推出一系列措施加強銀行業軟實力，包括(i)推出提升董事專業能力計劃；(ii)訂立整體業界的銀行從業員專業資歷架構；及(iii)推行消費者教育計劃。

# 2016年回顧

# 離岸人民幣業務

2016年環球金融市場波動及人民幣匯率前景不確定性令全球離岸人民幣業務有所放緩。截至年底，香港人民幣客戶存款及存款證餘額合共為6,251億元人民幣，較上年減少38%（圖1）。年內離岸人民幣債券發行量降至528億元人民幣，經香港銀行處理的人民幣貿易結算額亦降至45,421億元人民幣。另一方面，香港銀行截至年底的人民幣貸款餘額為2,948億元人民幣，與上年相若（圖2）。人民幣RTGS系統的交易額維持於高位，於2016年平均每日處理的交易額為8,636億元人民幣。由此可見，儘管人民幣資金池有所縮減，但仍繼續支持大量人民幣金融中介活動在香港進行。根據環球銀行金融電信協會(SWIFT)統計數字，2016年香港處理約七成人民幣支付交易，足以證明香港作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位。

圖1 人民幣客戶存款及存款證

圖2 人民幣融資活動

年內金管局與內地有關當局緊密合作爭取更大政策空間，推展香港人民幣業務。年內推出多項新措施，包括進一步加大內地銀行間債券市場及外匯市場對外開放，以及在12月推出「深港通」。因應跨境投資渠道及市場對流動性管理需求增加，金管局擴大人民幣流動資金安排。於10月，金管局將一級流動性提供行的數目由7間增加至9間，有關計劃的總額度亦由140億元人民幣增加至180億元人民幣。金管局人民幣流動資金安排使用情況的透明度亦提高，有助參加行更有效管理流動資金。

在3月公布的國家「十三五」規劃再次肯定香港作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位，顯示中央政府支持香港進一步發展離岸人民幣業務。

與此同時，金管局繼續加強與其他經濟體的合作，發展離岸人民幣業務。金管局亦積極參加各類活動，推廣香港作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐及內地「走出去策略跳板的主要角色，包括參與業界組織及私營機構舉辦的本地活動，以及在中國內地、德國、哈薩克斯坦和英國等地的境外活動。

# 內地與香港關於建立更緊密經貿關係的安排

在《內地與香港關於建立更緊密經貿關係的安排》框架下有關內地與香港基本實現服務貿易自由化的新協議，於2015年簽署。金管局繼續密切留意現行安排下的措施的實施情況，並與政府當局合作探討進步擴大內地市場對香港金融業的開放及便利措施。

# 基建融資促進辦公室(IFFO)

# IFFO的使命

IFFO的使命是透過匯聚主要持份者，共同促進基建投融資。IFFO的職能是：
- 提供一個資訊交流和經驗分享的平台；
- 提升基建投融資方面的技能和知識；
- 推廣市場及產品發展；
- 及促進基建投融資活動。

金管局總裁陳德霖先生（左七）於IFFO啟動儀式上聯同其他嘉賓祝酒。

金管局於7月成立IFFO，其使命是透過匯聚主要持份者共同促進基建投融資。截至2017年1月底，已有超過60間來自中國內地、香港及海外的機構加入IFFO成為合作夥伴，當中包括多邊金融機構及發展銀行、公營機構投資者、私營機構投資者、資產管理公司、銀行、保險公司、基建項目發展及營運機構、專業服務公司及國際貿易協會（表1）。

IFFO自成立以來取得良好進展。為致力提升技能，IFFO於10月聯同世界銀行集團旗下國際金融公司和瀚亞投資主辦行政人員工作坊，主題為「私營資金參與新興市場基建項目的投融資」。該工作坊獲得參與者非常正面的回應，有助增長知識及建立網絡。IFFO另於11月舉辦高層研討會，並邀請亞洲基礎設施投資銀行行長金立群先生主講及分享基建項目規劃、營運與管理的經驗。於7月，IFFO分別與國際金融公司及全球基礎設施中心簽訂《諒解備忘錄》，建立合作框架。另於12月分別與國家開發銀行及中國進出口銀行簽訂《諒解備忘錄》，透過IFFO平台促進該兩間銀行的基建項目融資。這些活動有助加強香港作為基建融資中心的地位及國際形象。

金管局總裁陳德霖先生（前左）與國際金融公司執行副總裁兼首席執行官菲利普• 勒奧魯先生（前右）簽署《諒解備忘錄》，促成兩者合作利用IFFO平台，為區內基建投融資營造更有效率及有利的市場環境。

金管局總裁陳德霖先生（前左）與全球基礎設施中心首席執行官Chris Heathcote先生（前右）簽署《諒解備忘錄》，建立策略性合作框架，促進基建項目融資。

金管局總裁陳德霖先生（左）與國家開發銀行董事長胡懷邦先生簽署《諒解備忘錄》，加強該行與金管局的合作。

# 企業財資中心

為進一步吸引跨國公司在香港設立企業財資中心，金管局與政府當局合作，營造一個對企業財資中心有利的稅務環境。具體上，《2016年稅務（修訂）（第2號）條例》（《修訂條例》）於6月通過，容許企業在符合指明條件下，在計算利得稅時可獲扣減經營集團內部融資業務的利息支出，以及就合資格企業財資中心指明財資業務的利潤，寬減利得稅百分之五十（即降至8.25%）。表2簡載《修訂條例》部分要點：

除立法工作外，金管局亦積極向跨國和內地企業推廣在香港設立企業財資中心的優勢。截至年底，金管局已接觸近400間公司、金融機構及行業組織。金管局亦於11月與香港中國企業協會簽署《諒解備忘錄》，協助香港的中資企業進一步了解及更多利用我們的企業財資中心平台。

# 推廣資產管理業務

金管局繼續致力推廣香港作為資產管理中心。根據證券及期貨事務監察委員會（證監會），從事資產管理的持牌法團數目於2016年底為1,300間，按年增加近15%。根據《亞洲創業投資期刊》，2016年在香港的私募基金公司（包括證監會持牌法團及非證監會持牌法團）數目亦增加4.6%，至431間。迄今全球百大資產管理公司中有接近70間，以及內地二十大互惠基金公司中的大多數，已在香港設有業務或相聯公司。在香港駐設業務的機構投資者數目亦逐漸增加，其中作為全球第三大主權基金的阿布扎比投資局於10月宣布在香港成立海外辦事處，是該機構於阿布扎比以外設立的唯一辦事處。

# 引入開放式基金型公司結構

為吸引基金來港註冊，金管局繼續與政府及業界合作，營造更有利的稅務及監管環境。於6月，《2016年證券及期貨（修訂）條例草案》獲得通過，引入開放式基金型公司結構，令香港的基金註冊平台更多元化，並為基金經理營造更靈活的經營環境，從而加強香港作為國際資產管理中心的競爭力。

# 伊斯蘭金融

金管局繼續致力增加市場對伊斯蘭金融的認識和了解，包括聯同業界公會舉辦及參與伊斯蘭金融研討會及講座，並與市場參與者分享有關發行伊斯蘭債券的經驗，鼓勵它們使用香港的平台。繼成功發行上兩批伊斯蘭債券後，金管局與政府一直緊密合作，在市場條件合適時推出第三批伊斯蘭債券。

# Hong Kong's Role as a Global Financial Center

Hong Kong maintains its position as a global offshore RMB business hub. Last year’s tax revisions helped create a favorable environment for attracting multinational corporations to establish treasury centers in Hong Kong. To develop Hong Kong into an infrastructure financing center and a fintech hub, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) established the Infrastructure Financing Support Office and the Fintech Support Office within the year. The HKMA also issued 13 licenses to stored value payment tool issuers during the year. Hong Kong’s sound fiscal performance and substantial net external assets continue to be affirmed by credit rating agencies, with Standard & Poor’s maintaining its AAA rating for Hong Kong.

# Overview

Affected by fluctuations in global financial markets and uncertainty surrounding the RMB exchange rate, global offshore RMB business slowed in 2016. Nevertheless, Hong Kong maintained its position as the world’s leading hub for offshore RMB transactions, processing approximately 70% of global RMB payment flows. The launch of the Shenzhen-Hong Kong Stock Connect mechanism in December marked another milestone in the mainland’s capital account opening and represents a significant step in solidifying Hong Kong’s role as an international financial center. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority also strengthened financial infrastructure by expanding RMB liquidity support and implementing measures to enhance market transparency.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) established the Infrastructure Financing Facilitation Office (IFFO) in July to promote infrastructure development and position Hong Kong as a leading center for infrastructure financing. By bringing together key stakeholders, IFFO aims to foster growth in this sector. As of the end of January 2017, over 60 institutions had joined IFFO as partners. During the year, the HKMA also successfully secured legislative amendments to address tax imbalances and provide incentives, encouraging multinational and mainland companies to establish corporate treasury centers in Hong Kong, thereby generating more business opportunities for the financial and professional services industries. The number of institutional investors operating in Hong Kong has also steadily increased; notably, the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA), the world’s third-largest sovereign wealth fund, announced in October the establishment of an overseas office in Hong Kong—its sole location outside of Abu Dhabi.

The International Monetary Fund (IMF) gave a positive evaluation of our efforts to consolidate Hong Kong's position as an international financial center during last year's fourth Article IV consultation. Throughout the year, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) actively participated in international discussions, striving to promote global and regional financial stability. The HKMA also maintained close communication with international credit rating agencies, and these efforts helped secure the confirmation of Hong Kong’s credit ratings by major credit rating agencies in 2016.

Hong Kong's financial infrastructure's safe and effective operation and sustained development are essential to strengthening its competitiveness as an international financial center and a global offshore RMB business hub. In 2016, the four real-time gross settlement (RTGS) systems for interbank transactions and the central clearing system for debt instruments (CMU system) achieved a system availability rate of 100%, exceeding the target level of 99.95%.

In 2016, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority further strengthened Hong Kong's retail payment financial infrastructure. During the year, a total of 13 payment tool licenses were issued under the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance, which took effect in November 2016. The scope of electronic cheque services was also expanded to include cross-border payments between Hong Kong and Guangdong Province (including Shenzhen).

To promote the development of fintech in Hong Kong, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority established the Fintech Facilitation Office in March. Several key measures implemented throughout the year have made significant progress.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has introduced a series of measures to strengthen the professional standing of the banking industry, including (i) launching a program to enhance the professional competence of directors; (ii) establishing a professional qualifications framework for banking practitioners across the industry; and (iii) implementing a consumer education program.

# 2016 Recap

# Offshore RMB Services

Hong Kong’s offshore Renminbi business slowed in 2016 due to volatility in global financial markets and uncertainty surrounding the Renminbi exchange rate. By year-end, the combined balance of Renminbi customer deposits and certificates of deposit in Hong Kong totaled RMB 625.1 billion, a 38% decrease from the previous year (Figure 1). Offshore Renminbi bond issuance fell to RMB 52.8 billion during the year, and the value of Renminbi trade settlements processed by Hong Kong banks also decreased to RMB 45,421 billion. Hong Kong banks held RMB 294.8 billion in Renminbi loans at year-end, roughly unchanged from the previous year (Figure 2). The Renminbi Real-Time Gross Settlement (RTGS) system maintained high transaction volumes, processing an average of RMB 8,636 billion daily in 2016. This demonstrates that despite a reduction in the Renminbi funding pool, Hong Kong continues to support significant Renminbi financial activity. According to SWIFT statistics, Hong Kong processed approximately 70% of global Renminbi payment transactions in 2016, confirming its position as a leading hub for offshore Renminbi business.
